title: Pine Bush man who pleaded guilty to child sexual abuse sentenced 18 years in prison
text:
Pine Bush man who pleaded guilty to child sexual abuse sentenced 18 years in prison
GOSHEN - A Pine Bush man who previously pleaded guilty to sexually abusing a child was sentenced Thursday to 18 years in state prison and 10 years of post-release supervision.
Orange County District Attorney David Hoovler announced the sentence for Allan Bressler, 74, of Pine Bush.
Bressler previously pleaded guilty to first-degree course of sexual conduct against a child, a felony.
Hoovler said that at the time he pleaded guilty, Bressler admitted that between March 1, 2008, and Feb. 1, 2013, he engaged in two or more acts of sexual conduct, including at least one act of oral sexual contact, with a child less than 11 years old.
Those acts took place in the vicinity of Bressler's Pine Bush home.
In addition to the prison sentence, Bressler will be registered as a sex offender.
"The horrifying conduct of this offender is truly hard to comprehend," Hoovler said in a statement released by his office. "While no amount of incarceration can restore to the victim what was taken, the sentence imposed on this defendant should, rightfully, ensure that he will never again be able to victimize a child."
Bressler's attorney, Brandon Ozman, could not immediately be reached for comment.
Mike Randall covers breaking news for the Times Herald-Record and the Poughkeepsie Journal. Reach him at mrandall@th-record.com.
